intro: Amerimnon saigonense, commonly known as the Saigon starleaf, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
